head.supplied: Bot. Garden, ¶ 6/1/70 ¶ ¶ Some years ago, dear Sir Redmond, several of my volumes were presented by the trustees of the public library in an elegant form to the Libraries of their Majesties the Emper...

ab.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: -1in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: VPRS 5486/P0/1, inward correspondence, official letters miscellaneous p. 17, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.3335in;

div.p:
Some years ago, dear Sir Redmond, several of my volumes were presented by the trustees of the public library in an elegant form to the Libraries of their Majesties the Emperor of France, the King of Italy & the King of Prussia through their Consuls in acknowledgement of the donations of books to the Melbourne public Library from these Sovereigns.
x-ref.
Since that time one or two more volumes of mine are published, and it occurs to me, that probably the trustees might wish to complete the series of volumes this for the Paris, Florence & Berlin Libraries.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.3335in;

div.p: It is a mere suggestion of mine, in which I am not interested, but my thoughts might for the best, of the public Library deserve the Trustees consideration

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
